qualitative_description: The C++ candidate implements a full NPZ dynamical model that includes the core processes of nutrient uptake, grazing, recycling, and mixing, but does so with a richer set of ecological modifiers (seasonal light, temperature Q10 factors, yield, excretion, and optional quadratic mortalities). Many TRUTH processes are present as a member of the same family (e.g., Holling-type grazing, Monod/Michaelis–Menten nutrient limitation), though the algebraic forms differ in places (candidate uses multiplicative light limitation and Q10 temperature modifiers; TRUTH does not). Physical mixing of nutrients is implemented identically in form. The candidate also omits explicit physical loss/mixing terms for P and Z that appear in TRUTH (i.e., there is no k*(P_ext - P) or -k*P term), and uses slightly different routing of recycled fluxes (explicit rho_P, rho_Z, excretion, and (1-beta) routing). Overall: matching ecological roles are present, several components are ALTERNATE formulations from the literature, and additional ecological modifiers (light, temperature, yield, excretion, quadratic mortality) are included that are not in the TRUTH model.

nutrient_equation_uptake.matched_form: Monod/Michaelis-Menten nutrient uptake with multiplicative light limitation (LN * LI)
nutrient_equation_uptake.explanation: Candidate uses LN = Nprev / (K_N + Nprev + eps) and rP = mu_max * Theta_T_P * LN * LI and U_N = G_P / (y_P + eps) (lines: "Type LN = Nprev / (K_N + Nprev + eps);" "Type rP = mu_max * Theta_T_P * LN * LI;" "Type U_N = G_P / (y_P + eps);"). This is a Monod-style uptake (N/(K_N+N)) with an added light limiter LI and explicit yield y_P, which is an alternate to the TRUTH uptake form.

nutrient_equation_recycling.matched_form: Recycling from unassimilated grazing + routed mortality fractions
nutrient_equation_recycling.explanation: Candidate uses N_remin = (1 - beta) * G + rho_P * P_mort + rho_Z * Z_mort (line: "Type N_remin = (Type(1.0) - beta) * G + rho_P * P_mort + rho_Z * Z_mort;"). This explicitly routes (1-beta) of grazing and fractions of P and Z mortality back to N — an alternate parameterization of the TRUTH recycling terms.

nutrient_equation_mixing.explanation: Candidate uses N_mix = k_mix * (N_ext - Nprev) (line: "Type N_mix = k_mix * (N_ext - Nprev);") which is mathematically the same linear entrainment/relaxation term as TRUTH's k*(N0 - N).

phytoplankton_equation_growth.matched_form: Multiplicative Monod nutrient limitation × light limitation (rP * P)
phytoplankton_equation_growth.explanation: Candidate: G_P = rP * Pprev with rP = mu_max * Theta_T_P * LN * LI where LN = N/(K_N+N) and LI = I/(K_I+I) (lines: "Type rP = mu_max * Theta_T_P * LN * LI;" "Type G_P = rP * Pprev;"). This is a Monod-type nutrient uptake multiplied by a saturating light function — an alternate family to the TRUTH growth expression.

phytoplankton_equation_grazing_loss.matched_form: Holling-type saturating grazing P^h/(K_P^h + P^h) times Z
phytoplankton_equation_grazing_loss.explanation: Candidate implements grazing as g_fun = g_max * Theta_T_G * P_pow_h / (denom + eps) and G = g_fun * Zprev (lines: "Type P_pow_h = pow(Pprev + eps, h);" "Type g_fun = g_max * Theta_T_G * P_pow_h / (denom + eps);" "Type G = g_fun * Zprev;"). TRUTH uses lambda_ * P^2/(mu^2+P^2) * Z, which is the h=2 special case of this family, so the forms are equivalent up to parameter mapping.

phytoplankton_equation_mortality.matched_form: Linear + quadratic mortality (mPl * P + mPq * P^2)
phytoplankton_equation_mortality.explanation: Candidate: P_mort = mPl * Pprev + mPq * Pprev * Pprev (line: "Type P_mort = mPl * Pprev + mPq * Pprev * Pprev;"). TRUTH includes linear losses (s + k) * P but not an explicit quadratic P_mort; the candidate therefore implements the literature-listed linear+quadratic mortality alternate.

phytoplankton_equation_mixing.explanation: TRUTH includes a mixing/physical loss for phytoplankton via -(s + k) * P. Candidate dP = G_P - G - P_mort (line: "Type dP = G_P - G - P_mort;") contains no explicit mixing/relaxation term for P (no k_mix*(P_ext - P) or -k_mix*P), so the phytoplankton mixing term from TRUTH is missing.

zooplankton_equation_growth.matched_form: Assimilated grazing to Z: beta * G
zooplankton_equation_growth.explanation: Candidate: Z_gain = beta * G and dZ includes Z_gain (lines: "Type Z_gain = beta * G;" "Type dZ = Z_gain - Z_excr - Z_mort;"). TRUTH uses alpha * lambda_ * P^2/(mu^2+P^2) * Z; mapping alpha↔beta and lambda_↔g_fun makes these equivalent routing of assimilated grazing to Z.

zooplankton_equation_mortality.matched_form: Linear + quadratic mortality (mzl * Z + mZq * Z^2)
zooplankton_equation_mortality.explanation: Candidate: Z_mort = mzl * Zprev + mZq * Zprev * Zprev (line: "Type Z_mort = mzl * Zprev + mZq * Zprev * Zprev;"). TRUTH uses a simple linear loss -q * Z; candidate expands this to include quadratic (density-dependent) mortality, an alternate listed in the catalog.

zooplankton_equation_mixing.explanation: TRUTH has a term gamma * q * Z and uses k in P loss; there is no explicit physical mixing term for Z in the candidate model (dZ = Z_gain - Z_excr - Z_mort; line: "Type dZ = Z_gain - Z_excr - Z_mort;"). No k_mix*(Z_ext - Z) or -k_mix*Z is present, so explicit zooplankton mixing/entrainment is absent.

extra_components_description: 1) Seasonal light forcing & light limitation (I0, I_amp, LI) — modulates P growth. 2) Temperature Q10 modifiers (Q10, Q10_g → Theta_T_P, Theta_T_G) — temperature-dependent rates for growth and grazing. 3) Yield (y_P) — explicit conversion of C uptake to P biomass (G_P / y_P gives nutrient uptake). 4) Explicit zooplankton excretion ex_z (Z_excr = ex_z * Z) separated from mortality routing. 5) Quadratic mortality terms for P and Z (mPq * P^2, mZq * Z^2) as explicit density-dependent losses. 6) Generalized Holling order (h) allowing Type-II/III switching (P^h/(K_P^h + P^h)), i.e., a more flexible grazing functional form.
